node.title: The 'calculated risk' Lizzie took to secure her spot in Queensland's red hot property market
node.alt: Lizzie stands in front of an apartment block
node.description: Queensland first-home buyers are bucking the national trend by snappingÂ up real estate at the fastest rate in 13 years even as prices soar "through the roof".
node.content:
["Queensland first-home buyers are bucking the national trend by snapping up real estate at the fastest rate in 13 years, the Real Estate Institute of Queensland (REIQ) says.", "With prices soaring \"through the roof\" at a 20-year high, savvy young buyers are settling for less just to get their foot in the door.", "REIQ chief executive officer Antonia Mercorella said first-home buyers were buying\u00a0around 3,000 homes every month in the Sunshine state.", "Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS) data said\u00a0a year ago that figure was down to around 2,000 a month, but sales started to outpace other states early on in the new year.\u00a0", "\"Certainly what we are seeing the market doing nationally is pretty extraordinary and so you can understand why there is a lot of talk around affordability, and that first-home buyers are being shut out of the market,\" Ms Mercorella said.", "", "
REIQ\u00a0chief executive officer Antonia Mercorella says first-home buyers are not being shut out of the market in Queensland.
", "\"But I think when you look at Queensland it is quite a different story and the statistics tell us that actually in Queensland, when we look at first-home-buyer loans, they are at the highest level we have seen since 2008.", "
Calculated risks to get a foot in the door
", "Lizzie Delaney, 27, had her heart set on a small, old Queenslander but realised she had to downsize her expectations as prices soared.", "\"It was hard but just something I had to do, you have to get your foot in the door at some point, so it is a good start,\" she said.", "", "
First home buyer Lizzie Delaney celebrates after cracking into Brisbane's real estate market.(ABC News: Lexy Hamilton-Smith)
", "The marketing co-ordinator has just gone unconditional on a 30-year-old, two-bedroom unit in Toowong\u00a0in Brisbane's inner west.", "She saved up a 20 per cent deposit and paid $450,000.", "\"I have been saving basically since I finished school \u2014\u00a0it was a bit difficult but I got there,\" she said.", "", "
Lizzie Delaney is thrilled with her new Toowong apartment.(Domain)
", "Ms Delaney said she also took a gamble ditching a finance clause in her contract, as there were several other bidders on the property.", "\"It was a bit of a calculated risk but I knew I had pre-approval,\" she said.", "\"I am so excited now and [I'm] looking at furniture shopping online.", "\"It is a really great place to establish myself as a real adult, I suppose, rather than an early 20s share house\u00a0girl.\"", "", "
First-home buyer Lizzie Delaney with agent Brock Smith.(ABC News: Lexy Hamilton-Smith)
", "Agent Brock Smith said Ms Delaney was over the moon when he gave her the good news about winning the contract on the unit.", "\"She was stoked, you could hear the smile over the phone that she was the one person out of the group who managed to buy it with multiple offers,\" he said.", "\"You could hear the relief in her voice even thought it was not done and settled.", "\"It is certainly not an enjoyable part of the job telling people they have missed out, particularly if it is more than once you've told the same person.\"", "
'I have to go all out and go out quick'
", "Health worker Maree Smith, 45, is sleeping on a mattress in the bedroom of her new home in the Ipswich suburb of Silkstone \u2013 but she could not be happier.", "The first-home buyer found a cute cottage on a 959-square metre block with subdivision potential for $500,000 after missing out on countless others at Redcliffe and Brisbane.", "", "
Maree Smith said she \"went all out\" to secured her new home.(ABC News: Lexy Hamilton-Smith)
", "She spent the last two years saving 40 per cent\u00a0of her salary after her employer agreed to pay for her accommodation as a locum healthcare worker, to help her get the deposit over the line.", "\"They were really supportive for me to do this but I did not think I would be able to make it with the market going up,\" she said.", "\"I knew I wanted a bigger block, something with potential.", "\"I started to seriously look online in this area as I was sick of losing out to cash buyers and people pushing up the price.", "\"I feel amazing I have finally made it and will try and buy some furniture now.\"", "", "
Health worker Maree Smith celebrates as she sits on the steps of her first home she has bought in Ipswich, west of Brisbane.(ABC News: Lexy Hamilton-Smith)
", "Ipswich agent June Frank said the region was affordable and she was seeing a lot of novice buyers starting to move out to the region to simply \"get in\".", "\"Half-a-million [dollars] still buys you a very nice home here and if you go up to $850,000 you are certainly not buying a renovator \u2014\u00a0getting a lovely house with a pool, a nice neighbourhood.", "\"It is the same as it always has been \u2014 discipline yourself\u00a0and go hard \u2014 anything is achievable if you set a goal and make it happen\".", "", "
Maree Smith is one the search for furniture after making her house purchase.(realestate.com.au)
", "
Young people settling for less
", "The REIQ said although prices were soaring in Queensland, they were still cheaper than New South Wales and Victoria.", "Ms Mercorella said first-home-buyer advantage schemes were driving the new home market but it was the fact younger people were settling for less that was allowing them to snatch their slice of the great Australian dream.", "\"We know of course your dollar goes much further if you are prepared to be a little bit open-minded,\" she said.", "", "
First-home buyers have been urged to lower their expectations when buying into Queensland\u00a0property market.(ABC News: Mark Leonardi)
", "The tight rental market and historically low interest rates were\u00a0also prompting renters to buy into the market.", "\"It is often actually cheaper to buy than to rent, and you are not then in that very competitive rental landscape we have seen since the pandemic began,\" she said.", "Market analyst Terry Ryder from Hotspotting.com.au said while young buyers down south felt they were the \"lost generation\" when it came to housing, it was not the case in Queensland.", "\"Borrowing up to a million dollars to buy the dream home first up is tantamount to a young person leaving home and they want to buy a Rolls-Royce.", "\"Most young people get a Toyota Corolla or a second-hand car of some description and I think first-home buyers need to think in those terms too.", "\"The fact we've seen a\u00a050 per cent\u00a0increase in first-home buyers in the\u00a0last 12 months is also testament to the affordability and the lifestyle on offer in Brisbane and across regional Queensland.", "\"In Brisbane and regional Queensland, pricing is much lower, Brisbane pricing is approximately half that of Sydney.", "\"But also around regional Queensland,\u00a0there are lots of regional cities with very affordable options.\"", "Mr Ryder's top picks in the south-east were Logan, Ipswich, Moreton Bay and apartment living in Brisbane.", "He said regionally, sales data showed Toowoomba, Hervey Bay, Townsville Rockhampton, Mackay and Bundaberg still had houses on a block of land for $300,000 to $400,000, with apartments even cheaper.", "
Tightened bank lending restrictions
", "There were no doubt mortgage jitters, though, as banks started applying a higher mandatory interest rate buffer in case they go up again\u00a0on loan applications from November 1.", "So what effect will that have on lending to first-home buyers?", "Mr Ryder believed there would be some impact but it would not be\u00a0broad.", "\"There were some figures from one of the major banks recently that showed only 7 per cent\u00a0of the customers who are borrowing are actually maximising to the absolute limit of their borrowing capacity, which means 93 per cent\u00a0are not,\" he said.", "\"So there is some leg room for that restriction and most people will still get the loans they can.", "\"And I don't think it is going to be any different this time.\u00a0This up cycle will continue because there are so many powerful forces driving it at the moment.\"", "Ms Mercorella said she had heard horror stories of young buyers losing their entire deposits after defaulting on a contract because finance fell over and they had no \"get out free cards\" legally.", "\"So whilst I understand that there is a sense of urgency and there is FOMO floating around, fear of missing out, I would still say to first-home buyers that it is incredibly important that before you commit to a contract that you are absolutely confident you have your ducks in a row,\" she said.", "Ms Delaney did and has already had a champagne celebration ahead of moving in day.", "\"But every step of the way I had to consult with mum and dad. It is great to have other people in your life who have done it before to answer questions,\" she said.", "Plans for a Christmas \"first house\" party were in progress, while a meet and greet was underway of other owners as a new generation of buyers move in."]
